body:
People in the thread in +TheMemery talking about this: @milkit @roybatty @nationalsocialism @crystalvulpine

@captainmeta4 @kek @arkitekt

To the admins:

Please take appropriate action against @ Emerald41 for what seems to be an obvious case of evading per user limits set in the Ruqqus ToS under multiple accounts with the use of an alternate account @ sapphire41.

Also. please reverse the sieges of +hitlerwasright and +forbiddenfacts as they are invalid and should have been protected, given it was a temp ban. Please also put protections on any other guilds @JosephGoebbels used to be a guildmaster of, thank you.

UPDATE: @JosephGoebbels account has been set to a tempban, and his sentence was commuted because JG is considered his main. Also, the siege by Emerald41 has been declared a violation of the per user limit on the 30 day cooldown on sieging.

body:
We're in admin chat discussing this GM/alt scenario moving forward.

So after klen, we revised the ToS to communicate that you cannot use multiple accounts to bypass certain limitations such as guild modding. However, I believe it's important to have a strict protocol on defining which is an alt.

@captainmeta4 went by account age to determine JG's alts v main, which isn't that good of an indicator as compared to vote, comment, and posting activity. Unfortunately, this means JG's current guilds were not protected as JG wasn't the "main account", the account with earliest sign up timestamp.

imo JG was more of main account if we're going off activity rather than account creation.

Might have to include how determine a main vs an alt moving forward if we're going to be placing bans on them, and that could put an account's guilds at risk. Maybe even a siege cool down for guilds that were modded by a banned user, so they can't be immediately shit on by others.
body_html:
We're in admin chat discussing this GM/alt scenario moving forward.

So after klen, we revised the ToS to communicate that you cannot use multiple accounts to bypass certain limitations such as guild modding. However, I believe it's important to have a strict protocol on defining which is an alt.

@captainmeta4 went by account age to determine JG's alts v main, which isn't that good of an indicator as compared to vote, comment, and posting activity. Unfortunately, this means JG's current guilds were not protected as JG wasn't the "main account", the account with earliest sign up timestamp.

imo JG was more of main account if we're going off activity rather than account creation.

Might have to include how determine a main vs an alt moving forward if we're going to be placing bans on them, and that could put an account's guilds at risk. Maybe even a siege cool down for guilds that were modded by a banned user, so they can't be immediately shit on by others.

body:
It's not a double standard. I'll explain why.

JG is going to be punished no matter what, but he should get his guilds back at the very least per standard tempban procedure. JG's punishment is a 7 day tempban, and I'm not contesting that. However, there is precedent with other tempbans that original guildmasters will get their guilds back on their main accounts that were taken by invalid sieges. But I'm still okay with the 7 day tempban, so long as JG gets his guilds back.

So it's not a double standard, since I'm still okay with the punishment of both users. JG however, should be protected by precedent on his guilds being sieged on a tempban.

However, the tempban is disputed based on account age and activity with the admins right now, so we'll see where that goes.

parent.body:
We're in admin chat discussing this GM/alt scenario moving forward.

So after klen, we revised the ToS to communicate that you cannot use multiple accounts to bypass certain limitations such as guild modding. However, I believe it's important to have a strict protocol on defining which is an alt.

@captainmeta4 went by account age to determine JG's alts v main, which isn't that good of an indicator as compared to vote, comment, and posting activity. Unfortunately, this means JG's current guilds were not protected as JG wasn't the "main account", the account with earliest sign up timestamp.

imo JG was more of main account if we're going off activity rather than account creation.

Might have to include how determine a main vs an alt moving forward if we're going to be placing bans on them, and that could put an account's guilds at risk. Maybe even a siege cool down for guilds that were modded by a banned user, so they can't be immediately shit on by others.
parent.body_html:
We're in admin chat discussing this GM/alt scenario moving forward.

So after klen, we revised the ToS to communicate that you cannot use multiple accounts to bypass certain limitations such as guild modding. However, I believe it's important to have a strict protocol on defining which is an alt.

@captainmeta4 went by account age to determine JG's alts v main, which isn't that good of an indicator as compared to vote, comment, and posting activity. Unfortunately, this means JG's current guilds were not protected as JG wasn't the "main account", the account with earliest sign up timestamp.

imo JG was more of main account if we're going off activity rather than account creation.

Might have to include how determine a main vs an alt moving forward if we're going to be placing bans on them, and that could put an account's guilds at risk. Maybe even a siege cool down for guilds that were modded by a banned user, so they can't be immediately shit on by others.

parent.body:
We're in admin chat discussing this GM/alt scenario moving forward.

So after klen, we revised the ToS to communicate that you cannot use multiple accounts to bypass certain limitations such as guild modding. However, I believe it's important to have a strict protocol on defining which is an alt.

@captainmeta4 went by account age to determine JG's alts v main, which isn't that good of an indicator as compared to vote, comment, and posting activity. Unfortunately, this means JG's current guilds were not protected as JG wasn't the "main account", the account with earliest sign up timestamp.

imo JG was more of main account if we're going off activity rather than account creation.

Might have to include how determine a main vs an alt moving forward if we're going to be placing bans on them, and that could put an account's guilds at risk. Maybe even a siege cool down for guilds that were modded by a banned user, so they can't be immediately shit on by others.
parent.body_html:
We're in admin chat discussing this GM/alt scenario moving forward.

So after klen, we revised the ToS to communicate that you cannot use multiple accounts to bypass certain limitations such as guild modding. However, I believe it's important to have a strict protocol on defining which is an alt.

@captainmeta4 went by account age to determine JG's alts v main, which isn't that good of an indicator as compared to vote, comment, and posting activity. Unfortunately, this means JG's current guilds were not protected as JG wasn't the "main account", the account with earliest sign up timestamp.

imo JG was more of main account if we're going off activity rather than account creation.

Might have to include how determine a main vs an alt moving forward if we're going to be placing bans on them, and that could put an account's guilds at risk. Maybe even a siege cool down for guilds that were modded by a banned user, so they can't be immediately shit on by others.

Check the guildmasters of +BetaFeedback, +WatchRedditDie, and +technology.

They also:

* Are allowed to alpha test and give feedback on experimental features that the admins are dead-set on keeping secret to everyone else (focus group)

* Get more rewards from the admins

* Were planned to be given limited *admin privileges* (this one was conveniently scrapped after I told people about it).

* Have write access to the ruqqus codebase

* Are taken more seriously by the admins in general

* Any other special role, you can bet they got picked for it, usually without even asking for it.

body:
Like CrystalVulpine suggests, do you think it would be fair to only permaban alts if they were solely used to circumvent the per-account limitations? Some users could have multiple accounts that are all very active. I think that any account that wasn't solely used to violate the rules could be banned for 7 days only, like the main account.

As for guilds, I thought that you could ask the user which 10 guilds they liked the most, and they could choose the account to mod those 10 guilds on. This does seem rather hard without any way to communicate with the user though, so for now, I guess you could let them keep the guilds on their most active accounts (like what you're currently planning on doing in the future).

I'm not sure how well a siege cool down would work. It's better than what we have now, but users could just wait wait until the cooldown ends to immediately siege their guilds, kind of like what the RCP does now but with a period of time before the ban and the sieging of the guilds.

Edit: I didn't see cap's thread.

<sup> - sfrohne [If you're going to post a screenshot of this comment, **don't** censor my username]</sup>
body_html:
Like CrystalVulpine suggests, do you think it would be fair to only permaban alts if they were solely used to circumvent the per-account limitations? Some users could have multiple accounts that are all very active. I think that any account that wasn't solely used to violate the rules could be banned for 7 days only, like the main account.

As for guilds, I thought that you could ask the user which 10 guilds they liked the most, and they could choose the account to mod those 10 guilds on. This does seem rather hard without any way to communicate with the user though, so for now, I guess you could let them keep the guilds on their most active accounts (like what you're currently planning on doing in the future).

I'm not sure how well a siege cool down would work. It's better than what we have now, but users could just wait wait until the cooldown ends to immediately siege their guilds, kind of like what the RCP does now but with a period of time before the ban and the sieging of the guilds.

Edit: I didn't see cap's thread.

parent.body:
We're in admin chat discussing this GM/alt scenario moving forward.

So after klen, we revised the ToS to communicate that you cannot use multiple accounts to bypass certain limitations such as guild modding. However, I believe it's important to have a strict protocol on defining which is an alt.

@captainmeta4 went by account age to determine JG's alts v main, which isn't that good of an indicator as compared to vote, comment, and posting activity. Unfortunately, this means JG's current guilds were not protected as JG wasn't the "main account", the account with earliest sign up timestamp.

imo JG was more of main account if we're going off activity rather than account creation.

Might have to include how determine a main vs an alt moving forward if we're going to be placing bans on them, and that could put an account's guilds at risk. Maybe even a siege cool down for guilds that were modded by a banned user, so they can't be immediately shit on by others.
parent.body_html:
We're in admin chat discussing this GM/alt scenario moving forward.

So after klen, we revised the ToS to communicate that you cannot use multiple accounts to bypass certain limitations such as guild modding. However, I believe it's important to have a strict protocol on defining which is an alt.

@captainmeta4 went by account age to determine JG's alts v main, which isn't that good of an indicator as compared to vote, comment, and posting activity. Unfortunately, this means JG's current guilds were not protected as JG wasn't the "main account", the account with earliest sign up timestamp.

imo JG was more of main account if we're going off activity rather than account creation.

Might have to include how determine a main vs an alt moving forward if we're going to be placing bans on them, and that could put an account's guilds at risk. Maybe even a siege cool down for guilds that were modded by a banned user, so they can't be immediately shit on by others.

parent.body:
We're in admin chat discussing this GM/alt scenario moving forward.

So after klen, we revised the ToS to communicate that you cannot use multiple accounts to bypass certain limitations such as guild modding. However, I believe it's important to have a strict protocol on defining which is an alt.

@captainmeta4 went by account age to determine JG's alts v main, which isn't that good of an indicator as compared to vote, comment, and posting activity. Unfortunately, this means JG's current guilds were not protected as JG wasn't the "main account", the account with earliest sign up timestamp.

imo JG was more of main account if we're going off activity rather than account creation.

Might have to include how determine a main vs an alt moving forward if we're going to be placing bans on them, and that could put an account's guilds at risk. Maybe even a siege cool down for guilds that were modded by a banned user, so they can't be immediately shit on by others.
parent.body_html:
We're in admin chat discussing this GM/alt scenario moving forward.

So after klen, we revised the ToS to communicate that you cannot use multiple accounts to bypass certain limitations such as guild modding. However, I believe it's important to have a strict protocol on defining which is an alt.

@captainmeta4 went by account age to determine JG's alts v main, which isn't that good of an indicator as compared to vote, comment, and posting activity. Unfortunately, this means JG's current guilds were not protected as JG wasn't the "main account", the account with earliest sign up timestamp.

imo JG was more of main account if we're going off activity rather than account creation.

Might have to include how determine a main vs an alt moving forward if we're going to be placing bans on them, and that could put an account's guilds at risk. Maybe even a siege cool down for guilds that were modded by a banned user, so they can't be immediately shit on by others.

>Because you are desperate for validation

I like a conversation same as the next guy. I don't believe in stopping them, unless its annoying,  which you are not

>Now you’re admitting that any idiot can do what you do

[From the Smithsonian... pushing a button is easy, Knowing which button to push is hard](https://www.smithsonianmag.com/history/charles-proteus-steinmetz-the-wizard-of-schenectady-51912022/)

>Ford, whose electrical engineers couldn’t solve some problems they were having with a gigantic generator, called Steinmetz in to the plant. Upon arriving, Steinmetz rejected all assistance and asked only for a notebook, pencil and cot. According to Scott, Steinmetz listened to the generator and scribbled computations on the notepad for two straight days and nights. On the second night, he asked for a ladder, climbed up the generator and made a chalk mark on its side. Then he told Ford’s skeptical engineers to remove a plate at the mark and replace sixteen windings from the field coil. They did, and the generator performed to perfection.

>Henry Ford was thrilled until he got an invoice of $10,000. Ford acknowledged Steinmetz’s success but balked at the figure. He asked for an itemized bill.

>Steinmetz, Scott wrote, responded personally to Ford’s request with the following:

>Making chalk mark on generator $1.

>Knowing where to make mark $9,999.

>Ford paid the bill.
